active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the strengths and limitations of Oxygen Forensic Detective compared to other mobile forensic tools like Cellebrite in terms of speed, device support, and compliance with NIST incident response phases. Support arguments with real-world DFIR examples and vote on the most versatile tool for OT environments.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity education, using Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, and scaffolding for 'Oxygen Forensic Detective' (Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > Forensic Tools and Techniques > 004_Forensic Tools and Software > Mobile Forensic Tools > Oxygen Forensic Detective). Voter consensus: 82.9% approval on pedagogy, peer interaction, etc. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste the 6 objectives above] - Active Learning: [reference discussion, peer teaching, problem-solving for scenario cards] - Scaffolding: [reference 4 layers with content summaries] - Prior Knowledge: Link to NIST IR lifecycle, chain of custody. - Research: All-in-one tool for 35k+ devices, 25k+ apps, extraction (logical/physical/cloud), analysis (timelines/decoding), NIST-aligned. Sources: oxygenforensics.com, nist.gov. - Big Picture: Key DFIR tool for mobile evidence in incident reconstruction. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards: - Distribute across Bloom's levels and scaffolding layers. - Use Flashcard Schema: MCQ front (4 options), back with correct answer, explanation (cite sources/objectives), distractor rationale, tags. - Vary formats: 40% definition/feature, 30% step-by-step apply, 20% compare/evaluate scenarios, 10% create plans. - Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'correct_answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors': [...], 'tags': [...]}, 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...'}] Ensure cards promote active recall, critical thinking, and retention for university-level mastery.
